contextId.information: The phrase "I am" is implied. AT: "I, James, am a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ

contextId.information: What a person is saved from can be made explicit. AT: "save you from God's judgment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This passage speaks of stricter judgment that will come from God on those who teach others about him. AT: "God will judge us more severely because we know his word better than others whom we have taught" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: we will receive more severe judgment

contextId.information: How this phrase relates to the previous verse can be made explicit: "But, even though our spirits may desire what we cannot have, God gives us even more grace, if we will humble ourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Possible meanings are 1) James is giving a strong warning to wealthy believers (UDB) or 2) James is talking about wealthy unbelievers. AT: "you who are rich and say you honor God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
